intro: Peperomia retivenulosa, commonly known as the veined peperomia, is a compact, evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It features glossy, dark green leaves with distinctive veining that gives it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm, making it ideal for indoor cultivation. Its foliage is often adorned with a waxy coating, enhancing its aesthetic appeal. Peperomia retivenulosa thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
